content:
I only *just* managed to solve this. Literally fixed a bug at the last second (14m59s). Seems like it could have been simplified a lot before becoming a clash, but oh well.

The string manipulation on top of the already challenging problem is like salt in the wound. :P

I was the only one to solve it in my clash, the other 2 human players both got 0% and a bot got 85%.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good contribution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good contribution

I think the definition of a graph would be more generic if you write something like "A graph is a mathematical structure" instead of a "data structure".
Good work anyway,

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear description and relevant test cases. Took me ~10mins to solve.

As a very minor note again, you probably want to change the test name "Recursive edge" to reflect the changes to the statement.

Cool one, just some minor notes:

- First time I see the expression "recursive edges". Did a bit of googling but couldn't find people using it. Otherwise the more standard term is just loop, or self-loop: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loop_(graph_theory)
- Also maybe non-directional > undirected. Now google says that non-directional is ok, but in my experience only undirected is used.
- Maybe "Graph" without caps to be consistent with the other definitions.
- You could treat as constants {1, 2} and {2, 1} (-> put in blue)
- Same for "ADD"  & "DROP"

That's all, took me 12 mins, the first 4 being me mistaking simple graph with acyclic and thinking that it made no sense (shame shame shame).

Also "A Graph is a data structure...". That's a programmer brain if I've ever seen one.

Your contribution has been uploaded twice. Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/5895393d466a0ebb817249ea7378bc3a30a09

Output section
* You may delete "Two lines:".

* Please format "ADD" and "DROP" as constants and remove the quotation marks.

* For Note 3, suggest to change "they have no edges" to "there are no edges to add or drop".

* Please move the notes to Goal section (and delete any if there is duplication with the existing contents in Goal section).

Constraints section
* Please mention the lower limit of n.

* Suggest to change the upper limit of n and m to 100 and 1500 respectively (just an approximate number is sufficient).

Thanks.

Apologies for the double submission. The first time I hit submit I got a "No Phrase error". I waited for a bit and nothing appeared so I submitted again. In any case, I deleted the other one.

I agree with all of your suggestions apart from the upper limit of n being 100, since n = 100 would require 4950 edges to complete, and the upper limit of n and m cannot stray too far.

Thank you for your feedback, if there's anything else let me know. It's my first submission so I'm not sure if I'm missing something.

Yup, it's called a loop. I don't think I've heard "recursive edge" anywhere, maybe I just had a fugue state xD

Agreed with the rest of the suggestions as well.

It's more than a little worrying if it took you 12 minutes (regardless of the fact that you wasted 4 of them, wasting time is traditional in clashes), I was worried while I was writing it since it kept increasing in complexity. If you don't mind, could you share the solution you came up with? Either on discord (I'm on the cg discord with the same name) or a private forum message, or however else is convenient for you.
Whoops! Fixed, thanks for pointing that out, and for the approval.

I didn't save it and since you edited the puzzle it reseted my submission F. Will try to write it again from memory and add it to this message.

edit: Yeah it's ugly I know :angry:
https://bpa.st/GKASM

Oh damn, sorry for the inconvenience. 

The solution isn't really ugly. It does seem like you came up with essentially the same logic as I did. I thought maybe removing the order requirement for DROP might make it simpler but it doesn't seem like it will at all.

Oh well, might as well submit for approval.
